Detailed Description

Planar polygons.

The Polygon class represents a closed n-gon in the plane. The vertices of the Polygon are held as a vector of Point objects.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Polygon::Polygon (   ) 
 

Default constructor.

This default constructor creates an empty Polygon, i.e., a Polygon without any points.

Definition at line 8 of file Polygon.cc.

References np, and vertices.

Polygon::Polygon (  int  n  ) 
 

Create a basic n-gon.

This creates a polygon with a specified number of points. The points are placed evenly around the unit circle.

Parameters:
n the number of points.

Point  P
) 
 

Move a vertex to a new location.

Note: If an invalid vertex index is given, no change is made to this Polygon.

Parameters:

Definition at line 35 of file Polygon.cc.

References np, and vertices.

double Polygon::perimeter (   )  const
 

Perimeter of this Polygon.

If the Polygon has fewer than two vertices, its perimeter is 0. If it consists of exactly two vertices, the perimeter is twice the distance between those points.

Returns:
the perimeter of this polygon
